intro: Peristylus alpinus, commonly known as the alpine peristylus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered white or greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Peristylus alpinus is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
